description: Former research establishment where Tommy Flowers built Colossus, the world's first programmable electronic computer in 1943. Blue plaque to be unveiled on 6 Sep 2023

factsheet.heading: Where Tommy Flowers designed and built Colossus
paragraphs: Tommy Flowers, whose ground-breaking work in engineering culminated in the design and build of the world’s first ever programmable computer, has been commemorated with an English Heritage Blue Plaque at his former workplace. The new plaque marks Chartwell Court, a monumental three-storey building in Dollis Hill. This former Post Office Research Station is where Flowers was given freedom to research and develop ideas, and where he designed, built and tested the computer – Colossus.

location.address: Chartwell Court, 151 Brook Rd, Neasden, NW2 7DW

name: Tommy Flowers at Chartwell Court (ex Post Office Research Station Dollis Hill)
